docs.snippet: Manohla Dargis and A.O. Scott answer readers' questions about their favorite foreign-language films of the year and if any of this year's nominees will go down as all-time classics....
docs.lead_paragraph: Manohla Dargis and A.O. Scott, the co-chief film critics of The New York Times, are answering Oscar-related questions this week, as they kick off what will be a monthly fixture in print and online. (Previous installments can be found here and here.) For future columns, they would like to hear from you about whatever movie-related subject piques your curiosity: individual films, industry trends, historical trivia. Write to them at askthefilmcritics@nytimes.com.

headline.main: The Critics on All-Time Classics and Foreign Films

docs.snippet: Anne Hathaway and James Franco continued to dole out clips that hint at what they will be doing when they host the show....
docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES- The Bagger was busy compiling our Oscar predictions yesterday, and amazingly, the Internet did not stop without us. Anne Hathaway and James Franco continued to dole out clips that tease at what they will be doing when they host the show - here's Ms. Hathaway performing an awkward mash-up of "Don't Cry for Me, Argentina" and "Rump-Shaker" and the two of them in a hazy "Grease" montage, Mr. Franco also started a Twitter back-and-forth with Cher when he posted a clip of himself (badly) singing "You Haven't Seen the Last of Me," her song from "Burlesque," which he said was cut from the telecast. (If it's true, this is a blessing.) For her part, Cher wrote that she would miss singing at the Oscars.
docs.abstract: Anne Hathaway and James Franco continued to dole out clips that hint at what they will be doing when they host the show.

headline.main: Franco and Hathaway Continue the Big Tease

docs.snippet: With time running out before Hollywood's big party, perhaps you're still struggling to complete that Oscar ballot. Who better to help than some famous movie buffs? Melena Ryzik, a k a the Carpetbagger, has spoken with figures from the media and en...
docs.lead_paragraph: With time running out before Hollywood's big party, perhaps you're still struggling to complete that Oscar ballot. Who better to help than some famous movie buffs? Melena Ryzik, a k a the Carpetbagger, has spoken with figures from the media and entertainment worlds for their insights. Here are snippets of those chats, which appear in full at nytimes.com/carpetbagger. Then click over to oscars.nytimes.com/ballot to see other celebrity picks and to make your choices. Katie Couric
docs.abstract: Melena Ryzik solicits Oscar winner picks from CBS News anchor Katie Couric, Univision host Raul de Molina, comedian Kristen Schaal and TV actor Nick Offerman. (M)
